name: Masala Fried Rice with Turmeric Onion Raita
description: Indian Spiced Masala Fried Rice with Turmeric Onion Raita. Use up the leftover rice or grains to make this quick spiced fried rice and serve with a simple yogurt raita that is spiced with turmeric and mustard seeds. Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Indian Recipe
recipeIngredient: 3 cups of cooked rice (white or brown or mixed, preferably basmati rice (1 cup dry rice will make 3 cups cooked))
1 tsp organic safflower oil or other neutral oil
1/2 tsp cumin seeds
1/2 cup chopped red onion or white onion
4 cloves of garlic minced or 1 Tbsp paste
1 inch ginger minced or 1 Tbsp ginger paste
1 tsp ground coriander
1 tsp garam masala
1/2 tsp smoked paprika or regular
1/4 to 1/2 tsp cayenne / red chili powder
1.5 to 2 cups chopped veggies like cauliflower, (green beans, broccoli)
1/2 cup thinly sliced or chopped carrot
1 cup finely chopped peppers (red, green other)
1/2 cup green peas (fresh or thawed if frozen)
lemon juice to taste
3/4 tsp salt (depends on if the rice was already salted)
1 cup non dairy yogurt (plain, unsweetened  (see notes to make your own))
1/4 cup water
1 tsp oil
1/2 tsp mustard seeds
6  curry leaves (optional)
1/4 cup thinly sliced red or white onion
1/2 tsp turmeric
1/4 tsp cayenne
1/4 tsp salt

itemListElement.text: Heat oil in a large skillet at medium heat. Add cumin seeds and cook for a minute. Add garlic, ginger and onion and cook for 3 minutes. Add coriander, garam masala, cayenne, smoked paprika and mix well.
itemListElement.name: Heat oil in a large skillet at medium heat. Add cumin seeds and cook for a minute. Add garlic, ginger and onion and cook for 3 minutes. Add coriander, garam masala, cayenne, smoked paprika and mix well.

itemListElement.text: Add longer cooking veggies (cauliflower, green beans), 1/4 tsp salt and 1/4 cup water. Mix and cook for 8 to 9 minutes. Fold in quick cookies or veggies that want to have a crunch in and cover and cook until the veggies are al dente.
itemListElement.name: Add longer cooking veggies (cauliflower, green beans), 1/4 tsp salt and 1/4 cup water. Mix and cook for 8 to 9 minutes. Fold in quick cookies or veggies that want to have a crunch in and cover and cook until the veggies are al dente.

itemListElement.text: Add peas, salt and cooked rice, a splash of water and lemon juice and toss well. At this point you can fold in some baby spinach. Cover and cook for 2 minutes let sit for another 2 minutes to heat and steam well. Garnish with lemon and cilantro.
itemListElement.name: Add peas, salt and cooked rice, a splash of water and lemon juice and toss well. At this point you can fold in some baby spinach. Cover and cook for 2 minutes let sit for another 2 minutes to heat and steam well. Garnish with lemon and cilantro.

itemListElement.text: Whisk the yogurt with a bit of water until smooth and set aside. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. When hot, add 1/2 tsp mustard seeds and let then start to pop. Add curry leaves and after few seconds, add sliced onion and pinch of salt. Cook for 3 minutes, stir occasionally. Add turmeric and cayenne and mix in. Cook for a few seconds. Add the whisked yogurt and salt and mix in. Cook for 2 minutes. Fold in chopped cilantro or mint.
itemListElement.name: Whisk the yogurt with a bit of water until smooth and set aside. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. When hot, add 1/2 tsp mustard seeds and let then start to pop. Add curry leaves and after few seconds, add sliced onion and pinch of salt. Cook for 3 minutes, stir occasionally. Add turmeric and cayenne and mix in. Cook for a few seconds. Add the whisked yogurt and salt and mix in. Cook for 2 minutes. Fold in chopped cilantro or mint.
